app.shared.utils.logging¶

A module for logging progress

class app.shared.utils.logging.ConsoleColors¶

Color codes for console output

Last digit: 0 black 1 red 2 green 3 yellow 4 blue 5 magenta 6 cyan 7 white

class app.shared.utils.logging.JobLogger(message: Message, description=None)¶

A class to log the progress of a job and send it back to the frontend

classmethod clearLogger(job_id: str | None = None) → TJobLogger | Type[LoggerHelper] | None¶

Clear the logger for the job

error(*s, exception: bool = False) → None¶

Log an error message (and send the state to the frontend)

Parameters:

  • s – The messages to log

  • exception – Add the exception to the log

classmethod getLogger(create: bool = False) → TJobLogger | Type[LoggerHelper]¶

Return or create the appropriate logger for the job

Only one logger is created per job, and it is stored in a class variable

Parameters:

create – Whether to create a new logger if it does not exist

Returns:

The logger for the job (or the helper if no job is running)

get_state(with_warnings: bool = False) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Get the state of the current task

info(*s, **kwargs)¶

Log an info message

iterate(iterable: Iterable[T], title: str = '', total: int | None = None, rate_limit: float = 1.0) → TqdmProgress¶

Monitor the progress of iterating an iterable (through tqdm)

Parameters:

  • iterable – The iterable to monitor

  • title – The title of the task

  • total – The total number of items in the iterable

  • rate_limit – The minimum interval between updates

progress(current: int = 0, total: int | None = None, title: str = '', key: str | None = None, end: bool = False, display: bool = False, send: bool = True, **kwargs) → None¶

Log the progress of a task

Parameters:

  • current – The current progress

  • total – The total progress

  • title – The title of the task

  • key – The key to identify the task

  • end – Whether to terminate the progress tracking

  • display – Whether to display the progress in the console

  • send – Whether to send the state to the frontend (default: True)

register_backend(backend: ResultBackend) → None¶

Register a result backend to store the results of the job

terminate() → Dict[str, str]¶

Terminate the job and return the final state

warning(*s, collapse: str | None = None, exception: bool = False, send: bool = False) → None¶

Log a warning message

Parameters:

  • s – The messages to log

  • collapse – The type of warning (to group similar warnings)

  • exception – Add the exception to the log

  • send – Whether to send the state to the frontend right now

class app.shared.utils.logging.LoggedResults(*, backend=None, store_results=False, result_ttl=None)¶

A class to store the results of a task in Dramatiq backend

before_process_message(broker, message)¶

Called before a message is processed.

Raises:

SkipMessage – If the current message should be skipped. When this is raised, after_skip_message is emitted instead of after_process_message.

class app.shared.utils.logging.LoggerHelper¶

A helper static class to log progress and errors

  • s – The messages to log

  • exception – Add the exception to the log

Monitor the progress of iterating an iterable (through tqdm)

Parameters:

  • iterable – The iterable to monitor

  • title – The title of the task

  • total – The total number of items in the iterable

  • rate_limit – The minimum interval between updates

classmethod progress(current: int = 0, total: int | None = None, title: str = '', **kwargs) → None¶

Log the progress of a task

Parameters:

  • current – The current progress

  • total – The total progress

  • title – The title of the task

Parameters:

  • s – The messages to log

  • exception – Add the exception to the log

class app.shared.utils.logging.LoggingTaskMixin(logger: TJobLogger | Type[LoggerHelper], *args, **kwargs)¶

A class mixin to log the progress of a task

class app.shared.utils.logging.TqdmProgress(*_, **__)¶

A TQDM progress bar that can be used to monitor the progress of an iterable, sending updates to a callback

close()¶

Cleanup and (if leave=False) close the progressbar.

update(n: int = 1)¶

Manually update the progress bar, useful for streams such as reading files. E.g.: >>> t = tqdm(total=filesize) # Initialise >>> for current_buffer in stream: … … … t.update(len(current_buffer)) >>> t.close() The last line is highly recommended, but possibly not necessary if t.update() will be called in such a way that filesize will be exactly reached and printed.

Parameters:

n (int or float, optional) – Increment to add to the internal counter of iterations [default: 1]. If using float, consider specifying {n:.3f} or similar in bar_format, or specifying unit_scale.

Returns:

out – True if a display() was triggered.

Return type:

bool or None

app.shared.utils.logging.base_logger = <Logger DEMO_API (WARNING)>¶

The base logger for the application

app.shared.utils.logging.console(msg, color='bold', e: bool = False)¶

Print a pretty message to the console

app.shared.utils.logging.notifying(func: Callable[[...], Any] | None = None) → Callable[[...], Any]¶

A decorator to notify the task of the progress of a function Sends back to frontend the results returned be the task when it is done Gives the task a logger to log its progress as a kwarg
